quest.title: The Pale Lady
quest.objective: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
tasks: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
quest.description:
Eisa's Journal
by Eisa Blackthorn

Night shift woke me to say they'd hit something big. Kyr, Ra'jirr, and I went down to take a look. It's huge, like a whole forest was just swallowed up by the earth, with a big old monument out in the center. Kyr took a sword from the monument as a trophy and dubbed it the "Pale Blade", proof his whole plan was finally paying off. For once, he might be right.

Ra'jirr's been having nightmares over the past few days. He keeps muttering about a "Pale Lady" - one of those swamp women who steal children away at night, I think. To think some fool story could turn the toughest bandit I know into a cowering kitten, frightened of his own shadow. I'm just glad none of the others see him like this.

It's getting worse. Ra'jirr can barely sleep at all now, and whenever he dozes off, he wakes up screaming - woke the whole place last night. He says the "Pale Lady" is coming for us - she's down in the forest, we have to return the sword or she'll kill us all. Not a chance - the boss clings to that thing like he was born with it. I've told everyone Ra'jirr just has a fever, but this can't go on. I've pulled a few things together. I'll slip out tonight and never look back.

quest.title: A Brush with Death
quest.objective: help Tivela Lythandas find her husband who has gone missing

quest.description:
I'm Tivela Lythandas. I apologize that I can't give you the respect a guest in my home would normally receive, but I am at my wit's end. I am sorry to be so forward, but I desperately need your help. It seems that my husband, Rythe, has gone missing, and I just don't know what to do.
Rythe is known far and wide as one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil. His specialty is setting the Great Forest to canvas. The paintings look so amazingly real that some say they can see the trees sway in the breeze. That's a silly notion of course, but it just goes to show the attention to detail Rythe uses when he paints.
Rythe likes to work in his studio with the door locked, so no one can disturb him. He usually comes out to eat dinner and sleep, but two days ago, he didn't come out at all. At first, I wasn't worried. He does that occasionally. But when he didn't come out for a full day, I unlocked the studio with the key he said to use only in emergencies. It turned out he wasn't inside! I'm sure he never left that room. So I have no idea where he's gone.
Please. Help me find Rythe. I love him dearly, and I am so worried. Here's the key to Rythe's studio. You may come and go as you please. If you need me, I'll be around the house.

plots: Kvatch was destroyed because they did not heed Slythe Seringi's warning about the Sunken One

quest.title: The Sunken One
quest.objective: investigate the Sunken One
quest.description:
Slythe's Journal
by Slythe Seringi

As midnight approaches, I still watch the fires burn. The great city of man, Kvatch, lay in ruins. They didn't heed my words. They didn't listen to my voice. Now, they are all paying the cost of ignorance. The Sunken One strikes swift and hard. He swats those who oppose Him as if they did not exist at all. The excuses of man fall upon deaf ears. The Sunken One has no pity; He has no mercy, He only sits below and passes sentence. And now, with a mighty stroke, He's toppled one of man's pitiful blights on His land. And yet, He still hungers. His appetite is voracious. Kvatch will not be the last city to fall by His hand. The world of man grows more and more corrupt, and it angers Him. Man's lies and deceit will be his undoing as The Sunken One grows impatient and no longer waits for or accepts the proper offering.
The burden is mine to shoulder. I am the last who knows of He Who Shakes The Ground. If I do not bring him the Offering, who knows what city may fall prey to his whim? Anvil? Chorrol? Or perhaps He will turn his eyes on the greatest boil of all, the great Imperial City itself. No, I must not let that happen. I must get the Offering to him like my father did before me. Man may be fallen in His eyes, but they must have time to learn The Sunken One's teachings. Destroying man now would be a waste, when I am certain that given the chance, they will come to see His ways. Yes, I will do this thing. I will brave the depths of Sandstone Cavern to see Him. My weapons will be my will and my word. The Sunken One will watch over me and guide me. I must depart soon, before it is too late. If anyone finds this journal, let them know that I, Slythe Seringi, do this for the good of all man.

quest.title: The Cold Flame of Agnon
quest.objective: get the Flame of Agnon to relight the great torch over New Sheoth
tasks: get the Flame of Agnon to relight the great torch over New Sheoth
quest.description:
You've seen the Great Torch that burns brightly over New Sheoth? No? Because it doesn't. It should. But it doesn't. You'll fix that. You'll go to Cylarne and bring back the Flame of Agnon to relight the torch.
Oh... and take care with my minions at Cylarne. In their eternal quest to please me, they're constantly fighting over Cylarne. It can be tiresome. But, really, it's divine. Divinely tiresome. Well. That's your problem now.
Off with you. I don't want to see you again until the Great Torch is lit. I wouldn't want to have to hurt you.

TESO259: the male Grandmaster of the Blades
TESO555: the legendary male Emperor who ascended to divinity

plots: Martin needs the blood of a Divine for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise in addition to the first item, the blood of a Daedra

quest.title: Blood of the Divines
quest.objective: recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
tasks: talk to Jauffre about obtaining the blood of Tiber Septim
recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
quest.description:
I've figured out another item needed for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise. The second item is the counterpart to the first: the blood of a Divine.
This was a terrible puzzle to me. Unlike the Daedra, the gods have no artifacts, and do not physically manifest themselves in our world.
How then to obtain the blood of a god? But Jauffre solved it. The blood of Tiber Septim himself, who became one of the Divines. This is a secret remembered only by the Blades, passed down from one Grandmaster to the next.
Jauffre should tell it to you himself.

TESS196: a fellow member of the Companions, and a werewolf
TESS110: the storied underworld of honorable heroes
TESS216: a tomb where lycanthropy can be cured
TESS200: the dead male leader of the Companions

plots: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy

quest.title: Purity
quest.objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
tasks: help Vilkas give up his beastblood
quest.description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

TL2109: a relieved Zeraphi master of explosives

plots: Hareph and his Zeraphi crew came to the outpost to deal with the Skara: the crew went to investigate the stacks and never came back
Hareph gives the player explosives

quest.title: Shadow of the Skara
quest.objective: help the Zeraphi any way you can
tasks: help the Zeraphi any way you can
quest.description:
I'm so relieved you have arrived! My crew and I journeyed to this outpost to deal with the increasingly aggressive Skara.
I remained here to fashion additional explosives while my crew investigated the stacks, but they never returned. I have been unable to leave here because of the swarming Skara.
Please take these explosives with you and journey to Swarm Point, and search for any surviving Zeraphi and help them in any way you can!

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry

quest.title: Canceled Wedding
quest.objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump
find the hidden dowry for yourself
quest.description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

TESS77: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold
TESS82: a powerful staff that can breach magical shields according to the Psijics

plots: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian

quest.title: The Eye of Magnus
quest.objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
tasks: get inside the College of Winterhold with the Staff of Magnus and reach Ancano
force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
quest.description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

TESS333: Torsten Cruel-Sea's daughter, who liked wearing a lot of jewelry
TESS334: a woman affiliated with the Summerset Shadows

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Fjotli was robbed and murdered: Torsten Cruel-Sea tracked down the murderer, a member of the Summerset Shadows, and killed him

quest.title: Summerset Shadows
quest.objective: remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
tasks: find information about the Summerset Shadows
remove the Summerset Shadows from the picture, and return Torsten Cruel-Sea's silver locket to him
quest.description:
My daughter Fjotli... she was murdered a few months ago. Left her laying on the ground in a pool of her own blood. I assume they were after her valuables... she always wore far too much jewelry in public. When I told her it'd be the death of her, I never thought...
No need to explain, I'm well aware of your Guild's methods do not include killing. It took me weeks, but I finally tracked down the killer. A bloody Altmer at that. Can you imagine? Let's just say I'm a firm believer in an eye for an eye and leave it at that.
The killer fancied himself a thief in some sort of a new Guild forming around here. Gave me some valuable information before... well, you know. Well, I think we can help each other. You recover what I'm looking for and take out a rival Guild in the process. One of the pieces stolen from Fjotli was a silver locket, a Cruel-Sea family heirloom. I want it back.
The only name I have is Niranye. Has a house right here in Windhelm. That's where you should begin looking.

plots: there are many new artworks and aged relics on display at the temple of Lathander
Dawn Ring was stolen from the temple of Lathander
the thieves were hired by the Talassans of temple of Talos

quest.title: Another Mission for the Temple of Lathander
quest.objective: return Dawn Ring to the temple of Lathander
tasks: intercept the thieves transporting Dawn Ring
return Dawn Ring to the temple of Lathander
quest.description:
Good day, it's Dawnbringer Sain, the priest of Lathander.
I would ask a dangerous thing of you. You're free to refuse, but the greater glory of Lathander is at stake.
The Morninglord takes great pride in the artifacts of his rule. We have many items on display at the temple of Lathander, from new artworks to the aged relics of bygone days. Today we are one less. We are the victims of thievery, and our followers have been shaken by this vulnerability. Quick steps must be taken to rectify this.
We know the culprits; they have not concealed their crime. Talassans, slinking from their temple to degrade our worship, hired common thieves for the deed! They fear no retribution. The Morninglord cannot suffer his relics in the hands of such evil.
Find these thieves before the Talassans receive the items.
The spark of dawn has lit the way.
Go to the filth of the slums at night and intercept the delivery of our Dawn Ring. Bring it back to its proper place.

BG24: a svirfneblin village to the north
BG26: a svirfneblin village to the north
a svirfneblin village to the north

plots: the player released Vithal from imprisonment
Vithal lost his book of rituals
Vithal needs the book of rituals to breach the walls between dimensions

quest.title: A Mage's Proposal
quest.objective: help Vithal breach the walls between dimensions
tasks: help Vithal breach the walls between dimensions
quest.description:
Ahh! Thank you for releasing me. I'm Vithal, an adventuring mage. If you could aid me a bit, I would be forever grateful. There will be items enough for us both.
This spot is "thin," and careful spells may breach the walls between dimensions. On the other side, one might find some valuable magic, if one knows where to look. I cannot cast the actual dimension-breaching spells without the procedures outlined in my book of rituals. I imagine it was taken after I was imprisoned. There were svirfneblin observing my conflict: Perhaps they took it. I cannot blame them. I am sure I appeared quite permanently lost.
I believe there is a svirfneblin village to the north. They may have taken my gear there. If you go, tell them they may keep everything but the book.

TESO163: a man who betrayed the player by joining Jyggalag
TESO164: a man who wants the player's Realm

plots: the player has come back to the Palace
The Font of Madness in the middle of the throne room in the Palace has been tainted with Order: as goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm
soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag: the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font of Madness
the traitor Thadon is probably behind the poisoning instead of Jyggalag himself

quest.title: The Roots of Madness
quest.objective: cleanse the Pools of Madness and the Font of Madness from the taint of Order
tasks: find the source of the taint of Order
cleanse the Pools of Madness and the Font of Madness from the taint of Order
quest.description:
Ah, you're back. You may have noticed that we have a... bit of a problem.
My Liege of course noticed the Font when you arrived in the Palace. The Font of Madness, in the middle of the throne room.
The taint of Order appeared only a short time ago, but it has spread quickly. As goes the Font of Madness, so goes the Realm. Soon we will all be serving a new master, Jyggalag.
Somehow the forces of Order have poisoned the Pools of Mania and Dementia that feed the Font. I suspect the traitor Thadon. Jyggalag has never had an original thought in his existence. Be that as it may. You will have to enter the Fountainhead beneath the Tree and find the source of the poison.

TESS296: a merchant dealing in used goods
TESS299: a woman who fancies herself a criminal investigator

plots: the player asked Revyn Sadri whether something in his store is stolen

quest.title: That Was Always There
quest.objective: return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
tasks: sneak inside the house and place Viola Giordano's gold ring in a dresser
return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
quest.description:
Of course nothing in here is stolen. Only a careless, shameful, idiotic fetcher would do something as stupid as to buy pilfered goods....
Oh by Azura, I've made a terrible mistake. I bought a gold ring, and Viola Giordano has been missing a ring that looks just like it.
Could you return the ring to her? It's not that easy. She'd go to the guard if she knew I was even remotely involved. You have to get it to her some other way.
Look, it's dangerous, but if you sneak the ring into her house. Put it in a dresser or something. I will make it worth your while.
